modules.description: Tracks and aggregates numeric values with named identifiers, supporting increment, reset, and retrieval operations. It works with counter and message types, enabling runtime monitoring of application behavior. Used to collect performance metrics or log event frequencies during execution.

Handles error reporting with location-aware formatting, expands and transforms `let` expressions during code generation, and defines rules for integrating custom syntax extensions into OCaml parsing and expansion workflows. Works with OCaml AST nodes, location metadata, and extension contexts. Used to instrument code for debugging by modifying variable bindings and top-level definitions during preprocessing.
